From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia




2022 Indian filmJanhit Mein JaariTheatrical release posterDirected byJai Basantu SinghWritten byRaaj ShaandilyaaShaan YadavScreenplay byJai Basantu SinghRaaj ShaandilyaaRajan AgarwalSonali SinghProduced byRaaj ShaandilyaaVinod BhanushaliVimal LahotiKamlesh BhanushaliVishal GurnaniShradha ChandavarkarStarringNushrratt BharucchaParitosh TripathiShaan YadavVijay RaazBrijendra KalaAnud Singh DhakaTinu AnandCinematographyChirantan DasEdited byJayant VermaJai Basantu SinghMusic byAman PantProductioncompaniesThinkink PicturezBhanushali Studios LimitedShree Raghav EntertainmentTake 9 EntertainmentDistributed byZee StudiosRelease date
10 June 2022 (2022-06-10)
Running time146 minutes[1]CountryIndiaLanguageHindiBudget₹12 crore[2]Box officeest. ₹5.12 crore[3]
Janhit Mein Jaari (transl. Issued in public interest) is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film directed by Jai Basantu Singh and written by Raaj Shaandilyaa. It stars Nushrat Bharucha, Paritosh Tripathi, Vijay Raaz among others.
It was released theatrically on 10 June 2022 and later premiered on video on demand on ZEE5 from 15 July 2022.[4][5][6] It received positive reviews from critics and audience, with praise for the message, humour and performances.


Plot[edit]
A story about a young girl who is a crusader and takes on a difficult job selling condoms. The film shows the struggles she faces amid the social taboo, and how she overcomes resistance from her family as well as the whole town. The film is told with Raaj Shandilya's trademark humor. The film follows a young girl selling condoms to make a living. She juggles her work towards improving women's lives, explaining the importance of protection and dealing with the resistance from her family members and in-laws

Production[edit]
Development[edit]
The film was announced by Indian boxer Mary Kom in November 2021, starring Nushrratt Bharuccha.[8][9]

Filming[edit]
The principal photography of the film started in mid-September 2021 at Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh.[10] However production was halted in November 2021 owing to COVID-19 pandemic in India.[11][12] The film was wrapped up on 17 December 2021 in Chanderi, Madhya Pradesh.[13]

Release[edit]
Theatrical[edit]
Janhit Mein Jaari was released theatrically on 10 June 2022.[14][15]
Janhit Mein Jaari earned ₹43 lacs at the domestic box office on its opening day. On the second day, the film collected ₹82 lacs. On the third day, the film collected ₹94 lacs, taking total domestic weekend collection to ₹2.19 crore.
As of 13 June 2022, the film grossed ₹2.50 crore in India.[citation needed]

Home media[edit]
The digital streaming rights of the film is owned by ZEE5. The film was streamed digitally on ZEE5 from 15 July 2022.[16][17]

Soundtrack[edit]
Janhit Mein JaariSoundtrack album by Prini Siddhant Madhav, Amol - Abhishek and Sadhu Sushil TiwariReleased23 May 2022[18]Recorded2021GenreFeature film soundtrackLength26:29LanguageHindiLabelHitz MusicOfficial audioJanhit Mein Jaari - Full Album on YouTube

The music of the film is composed by Prini Siddhant Madhav, Amol - Abhishek and Sadhu Sushil Tiwari with lyrics  written by Sameer Anjaan, Abhishek Talented, Raaj Shaandilyaa, Niket Pandey, Sadhu Sushil Tiwari and Rohit Sharma.[18]
On 12 May 2022, the first song titled "Parda Daari"[19] sung by Javed Ali and Dhvani Bhanushali was unveiled.[20][21]

Reception[edit]
Critical reception[edit]
Janhit Mein Jaari received mixed to positive reviews from critics. On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, 25% of 8 critics' reviews are positive, with an average rating of 5.8/10.[22]
Rachana Dubey of The Times of India gave it three and a half stars out of five and found that "A punch-line heavy discussion on safe sex".[23]
Akash Bhatnagar from Bollywood Bubble gave three and a half stars out of five and wrote, "Janhit Mein Jaari is a good and entertaining film. Nushrratt being the one with the most star-power here delivers to her promise. It's a good, clean film and deserves at least one viewing with the whole family."[24]
